definition: to flatter
to flatter/to cajole
flatter/charm
flatterer

sentences.english: How quickly their shrieks of pain turn to enraptured adulation.
sentences.chinese: 它们痛苦的尖叫迅速转变成对吾等恩赐的狂热谄媚。

sentences.english: A good man should disdain flatterers.
He had a cringing manner but a very harsh voice.
sentences.chinese: 他有卑屈谄媚的神情，但是声音却十分粗沙。

sentences.english: And parents or brother elder sister is flattering object you today.
sentences.chinese: 而父母或兄姐就是你今天谄媚的对象了。

sentences.english: But then they would flatter him with their mouths, lying to him with their tongues;
sentences.chinese: 他们却用口谄媚他，用舌向他说谎。

sentences.english: He is obsequious to men in power.
Many flattering relatives fawned on the rich old man.
sentences.chinese: 许多好谄媚的亲戚支巴结那个富有的老人。

sentences.english: I linger in front of an immigration officer with a sycophantic look on my face.
sentences.chinese: 我带着谄媚的表情在一间入境办公室门前徘徊着。

sentences.english: They came backstage afterward, cooing and toadying to him.
sentences.chinese: 她们随后来到后台，对他娇语谄媚。

sentences.english: Don't toady to or be obsequious to rich or powerful people.
sentences.chinese: 不谄媚奉承有钱或权势的人。

sentences.english: They always hold that we are flatterers around the king.
sentences.chinese: 他们总是认为，我们是君王前狡诈谄媚之辈。

sentences.english: To seek favor or attention by flattery and obsequious behavior .
sentences.chinese: 用拍马屁和谄媚的态度来取悦，引起注意。

sentences.english: To keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.
sentences.chinese: 能保你远离恶妇，远离外女谄媚的舌头。

sentences.english: Being a multi-selling megastar hasn't always been mass adoration and adulation.
sentences.chinese: 作为多产的巨星并不总是有大众崇拜和谄媚。

sentences.english: Chandler's weasel face screwed into an obsequious smile.
sentences.chinese: 钱德勒黄鼠狼似的脸上现出了谄媚的笑容。

sentences.english: I'm loving hug, also is no match for her a smile.
sentences.chinese: 我再蜜意的拥抱，也敌不外她谄媚的一笑。

definition: to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
to flatter/to toady
flattering and fawning (idiom)/sweet-talking
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
servile and bending the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
polite and modest
to bow and bend the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
lit. a vile character flourishes (idiom)/fig. an inferior person gets into a position of power, becoming conceited and arrogant
treachery/devious/a rogue
to put on a fake smile (idiom)/to smile insincerely
false/hypocritical/artificial/sham
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to despise/to look down upon/despicable
